column3: To his special lord icome of kynges blood
Ti Sire Phelyp þe eldest sone
and heire of þe passyng clere man Sire Phelyp
by the grace of God most noble kyng of Frensch men

column2: Suus deuotus Fr Aegidius Romanus Ordinis Fratrum Eremitarum S Augustini
column3: of þe ordre of frere heremytes of Seint Austeyn
þat is sentens of resonable rule

column2: omnes principatus non esse aequaliter diuturnos
nec aequali periodo singula regimina mensurari

column3: noþer al gouernans bien imete with euene duryng of tyme
and som ben idemed perpetual by heritage

column2: per haereditatem et successionem in filiis

column3: þat non violent thyng is perpetual

column2: et in suis posterioribus filiis suum principatuum perpetuari desiderat
column3: þat desireþ to make his principate perpetual in hymself
and successours schal study with gret bysynesse
þat is gouer nans be kyndelich

column2: Nunquam autem naturalis quis rector efficitur
column3: Neuer man is made kyndelich rector
zif he desireþ to be prince by passioun

column2: si custos iusti existens absque ratione

column3: Bot gif he is a kepere of rigt he schal ordeyne to commaunde no thing with oute resoun
as he is kyndelich a seruant
and redy of gouernans | is kyndelich a lord

column2: si vestra generositas gloriosa me amicabiliter requisiuit
column3: for youre gloryous nobilte requyred me frendly to compone or make a boke of loore of princes oþer of gouernans of kynges

column2: siue de regimine Regum quendam librum componerem
column3: and loke besilich gouernans of a regne by lawe

column2: et legem diligentius circumspecta polleretis regimine naturali

column3: þat is to say hym passyng
þat þis peticion is iaxed by excityng of God
þat almygty God in whos hemme it is iwrete

column2: vestrae domus sanctissimae curam gerere specialem
column3: ” haþ special cure of zoure holy hous
and worthi childhode to folwe þe fores of youre forfadres in þe whiche was gret
and parfite loue of þe fey

column2: in quibus peramplius et perfectius viget et viguit zelus fidei et religio christiana
column3: And Cristene religioun desireþ to kepe
and saue rigtful rules of þe regne by wit

column2: sed lege et intellectu regulas regni iustissimas cupiat praeseruare
Hac igitur requisitione laudabili et honesta

column3: that I acounte to me precepte

column2: necnon et suffragante bono gentis et communi
quod est diuinius quam bonum aliquod singulare
column3: þat is more godelich þan eny synguler profite
an auenture with likynge on þis worke by helpe of God as youre worthi nobelte haþ requyred
